name: Marcus Johnson
title: Chief Technology Officer
notes: Primary executive sponsor. Drove the initial evaluation after seeing our demo at re:Invent. Personally championed the POC and presented results to the board. Very hands-on technical leader.

name: Priya Patel
title: VP of Content Engineering
notes: Our strongest internal champion. Led the POC evaluation and authored the internal business case. Regularly advocates in leadership meetings. Has direct reports who would be primary users.

name: David Kim
title: Director of Data Science
notes: Technical champion who validated our ML models against their internal benchmarks. Confirmed 23% engagement lift in POC. His team would own the day-to-day integration. Very enthusiastic.

name: Sandra Williams
title: Chief Financial Officer
notes: Reviewed the POC ROI analysis and was impressed with projected $15M incremental revenue. Asked detailed questions about scaling costs. Gave verbal approval for the budget allocation pending legal review.

name: James Chen
title: VP of Product
notes: Third champion. Owns the product roadmap and has already slotted our integration into Q2 sprint planning. Shared detailed product requirements doc. Sees this as a key differentiator vs competitors.

name: Rachel Torres
title: Senior ML Engineer
notes: Hands-on technical evaluator. Ran the POC integration and was very impressed with API performance (<50ms p99 latency). Already prototyping the production integration.

name: Michael Chang
title: Head of Infrastructure
notes: Reviewed our architecture docs and approved the deployment approach. Comfortable with our multi-region setup. Offered to help with the production rollout plan.

name: Elena Rodriguez
title: General Counsel
notes: Primary legal contact. Initially had concerns about AI-generated recommendations and liability. After reviewing our compliance documentation and meeting with our legal team, most concerns are addressed. Remaining item is finalizing the data processing addendum.

name: Tomoko Nakamura
title: VP of Content Acquisition
notes: Excited about better content discovery for the long tail of their catalog. Sees AI recommendations as leverage in licensing negotiations. Plans to use insights for content acquisition strategy.

name: Brian Foster
title: Finance Director
notes: Reports to Sandra Williams. Handles the operational finance side. Confirmed budget is available in Q2. Helped model the 3-year cost projection and is supportive of the investment.

name: Aisha Okafor
title: Senior Product Manager
notes: Will be the primary PM managing the recommendation feature. Very engaged in requirements gathering. Already drafted user stories for the integration sprint.

name: Carlos Ruiz
title: Security Architect
notes: Completed security review ahead of schedule. Approved our SOC2 Type II report and encryption standards. No outstanding security concerns. Very professional and thorough.

name: Lisa Park
title: Head of Analytics
notes: Provided the engagement metrics framework used in the POC evaluation. Confirmed the 23% lift measurement methodology is sound. Wants to build custom dashboards using our API.

name: Derek Washington
title: Chief Content Officer
notes: Initially cautious about AI recommendations impacting editorial curation. After seeing the POC results showing improved long-tail content discovery without diminishing premium content, became a strong supporter.

name: Nina Volkov
title: Lead Platform Engineer
notes: Technical lead for the integration work. Reviewed our SDK documentation and gave positive feedback. Already submitted a PR for the initial API client wrapper in their codebase.
